function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Horizontal expansion and decentralization can lead to increased transmission of contagious diseases due to greater connectivity between different areas.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High-density districts and crowded urban areas can lead to higher morbidity rates of covid-19 and increased vulnerability among older people and men.","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential for increased disease transmission in densely populated areas","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High density urban areas facilitating easier transmission of communicable diseases due to increased social contact","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate management of multi-functional public spaces leading to increased risk of virus transmission","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Overcrowding due to concentration of amenities leading to increased risk of virus transmission","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Urban spaces not designed for pandemic mitigation norms and regulations","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Questioning the effectiveness of 6 feet physical distancing in urban spaces","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Vulnerability of architectural practices in accommodating pandemic procedures","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"High concentration of covid-19 cases in a major wholesale market.","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure of alternative options to mitigate the transmission of the virus.","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Difficulty in following physical distancing norms in urban public spaces","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased transmissibility of sars-cov-2 variants","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate air circulation and natural light may lead to high humidity, increasing the risk of viruses sticking and spreading easily.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inflexible layout design may lead to inadequate access to daylight and natural light, impacting the overall health and well-being of occupants.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Insufficient separation of wet and living spaces may lead to increased risk of cross-contamination and spread of pathogens.","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Rising prevalence and severity of pollinosis","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Excess algal growth in urban bodies of water","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risks associated with rodent habitat near ponds due to undisturbed vegetation","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Health risks associated with water toxins and algal blooms","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Algal blooms may produce phytotoxins and hepatotoxins, leading to water contamination and health risks for humans and animals.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Neurotoxins produced by algal blooms can affect the nervous system of exposed organisms, leading to severe health effects and potential fatality.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Algal blooms in urban ponds may pose less of a threat to humans, but still require monitoring and management to prevent any potential risks.","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased overgrowth of aquatic vegetation leading to low dissolved oxygen levels and stagnant water areas","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Excessive growth of algae and cyanobacteria in urban ponds","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poorly designed landscape details contributing to production of troublesome numbers of mosquitoes","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of natural predators in constructed bodies of water leading to increased mosquito populations","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High conductivity and low dissolved oxygen content in water leading to higher mosquito larval densities","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Constructed wet environments are the predominant producers of mosquitoes in urban areas","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Stagnant, shallow water is associated with high mosquito larvae counts in constructed wet environments","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Urban water bodies and wetlands providing habitats for mosquitoes","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High mosquito densities in constructed wet environments","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inefficient rodent control measures leading to increased rat populations","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate design and management of urban green spaces","category":"Nature","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Introduction of open surface water in urban design","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased asthma morbidity in inner-city children due to rat allergen sensitization and exposure","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential contamination of urban bodies of water with infectious disease agents from rats , campylobacter, salmonella, e. coli","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Overpopulation of urban rats","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Tick-borne disease prevalence in white-footed mice","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of chemical sprays and applications for tick control threatens harmless non-target species and provides only temporary results.","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inconsistent effectiveness of tick control methods in different ecological contexts, as demonstrated by the differing results of pyrethrin-soaked cotton fibers in different geographic locations.","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased risk of zoonotic tick-borne infections due to climate change-induced increase in tick population and expansion of their habitats.","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased presence of ticks in urban green spaces","category":"Biodiversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Arsenic exposure in bangladesh from construction of tube wells","category":"Water","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential community spread of sars-cov-2","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in small accommodation units due to shortened social distance with tourists","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Person-to-person transmission of contagious diseases","category":"Communication
